title: Introduction to academiadates
text: following dataset tsibbledata monthly data counts Australian livestock used food. Notice first month July. can set fiscal academic year start seventh month sake whole first year. example can aggregate quarters trimesters. convert regular tibble make regrouping data new time index easier. unusual form date, Fall 2025, can convert column date type, 2025-09-01, convert yeartrimester yeartrimester(). (intend add conversion term name calendar year directly yeartrimester object.)
code: library(academiadates) library(tsibble) library(tsibbledata) # an example dataset library(dplyr) aus_livestock #> # A tsibble: 29,364 x 4 [1M] #> # Key:       Animal, State [54] #>       Month Animal                     State                        Count #>       <mth> <fct>                      <fct>                        <dbl> #>  1 1976 Jul Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  2300 #>  2 1976 Aug Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  2100 #>  3 1976 Sep Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  2100 #>  4 1976 Oct Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  1900 #>  5 1976 Nov Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  2100 #>  6 1976 Dec Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  1800 #>  7 1977 Jan Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  1800 #>  8 1977 Feb Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  1900 #>  9 1977 Mar Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  2700 #> 10 1977 Apr Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  2300 #> # ℹ 29,354 more rows # quarters aus_q <- aus_livestock |>      as_tibble() |>      mutate(Quarter = yearquarter(Month, fiscal_start = 7)) |>      summarize(         Count = sum(Count),         .by   = c(Quarter, Animal, State)     ) |>      as_tsibble(index = Quarter, key = c(Animal, State))  # trimesters aus_t <- aus_livestock |>      as_tibble() |>     mutate(Trimester = yeartrimester(Month, academic_start = 7)) |>     summarize(         Count = sum(Count),         .by   = c(Trimester, Animal, State)     ) |>      as_tsibble(index = Trimester, key = c(Animal, State)) aus_q #> # A tsibble: 9,788 x 4 [1Q] #> # Key:       Animal, State [54] #>    Quarter Animal                     State                        Count #>      <qtr> <fct>                      <fct>                        <dbl> #>  1 1977 Q1 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  6500 #>  2 1977 Q2 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  5800 #>  3 1977 Q3 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  6400 #>  4 1977 Q4 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  7700 #>  5 1978 Q1 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  7000 #>  6 1978 Q2 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  6900 #>  7 1978 Q3 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  7800 #>  8 1978 Q4 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  8500 #>  9 1979 Q1 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  7900 #> 10 1979 Q2 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  7900 #> # ℹ 9,778 more rows  aus_t #> # A tsibble: 7,368 x 4 [1T] #> # Key:       Animal, State [54] #>    Trimester Animal                     State                        Count #>        <tri> <fct>                      <fct>                        <dbl> #>  1   1977 T1 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  8400 #>  2   1977 T2 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  7600 #>  3   1977 T3 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory 10400 #>  4   1978 T1 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  9300 #>  5   1978 T2 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  9600 #>  6   1978 T3 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory 11300 #>  7   1979 T1 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory 10700 #>  8   1979 T2 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory 10100 #>  9   1979 T3 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  8000 #> 10   1980 T1 Bulls, bullocks and steers Australian Capital Territory  7300 #> # ℹ 7,358 more rows

title: Introduction to academiadates
text: built-plotting functionality limited. plotting functionality tidyverts ecosystem partly feasts package: Graphics. functions depend class index. means , without porting functions accommodate yeartrimester class, portion functionality work. (hope future, functionality can recreated manually time .)  bug tsibble using yearquarter fiscal_start. yearquarter_trans account offset, fiscal_start dropped transforming date inverting transform. ’ve worked around adding additional months transforming date. re-transformed yeartrimester offset, offset built-.
code: library(ggplot2)  aus_t |>      filter(         Animal == "Bulls, bullocks and steers",         Trimester >= yeartrimester('2012 T1', academic_start = 7)     ) |>      ggplot(         aes(             x = Trimester,             y = Count,             color = State         )     ) +     geom_line()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Steven Carter. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Carter S (2025). academiadates: Tidy-Handling Academic Dates. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/Steven314/academiadates.
code: @Manual{,   title = {academiadates: Tidy-Handling of Academic Dates},   author = {Steven Carter},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/Steven314/academiadates}, }

title: Tidy-Handling of Academic Dates
text: goal academiadates extend tsibble adding new class built assist handling date intervals common academic institutions, three terms annually. lubridate quarter() semester() methods access quarter semester date. lacks functionality variable number periods per year proposed tidyverse/lubridate#1134, received work. tsibble support quarters ecosystem. also provides scales wrap ggplot2’s date scales. can seen throughout Forecasting: Principles Practice Hyndman Athanasopoulos. first example quarter timescale Figure 1.1.

title: Tidy-Handling of Academic Dates
text: can install development version academiadates GitHub :

title: Tidy-Handling of Academic Dates
text: adjacent GitHub issues content covers brainstorming work surrounding extending tsibble: Stack Overflow answer: R tsibble add support custom index tidyverse/lubridate#1134 tidyverts/tsibble#316 tidyverts/tsibble#207

what: academiadates: Tidy-Handling of Academic Dates — academiadates-package
title: academiadates: Tidy-Handling of Academic Dates — academiadates-package
text: Extends `tsibble` adding class supports three terms per year.

title: academiadates: Tidy-Handling of Academic Dates — academiadates-package
text: Maintainer: Steven Carter steven.carter314@gmail.com

title: academiadates scales for ggplot2 — academiadates-scales
text: Defines ggplot2 scales yeartrimester index.

title: academiadates scales for ggplot2 — academiadates-scales
code: scale_x_yeartrimester(...)  scale_y_yeartrimester(...)  scale_colour_yeartrimester(...)  scale_color_yeartrimester(...)  scale_alpha_yeartrimester(...)  scale_fill_yeartrimester(...)  scale_size_yeartrimester(...)

title: academiadates scales for ggplot2 — academiadates-scales
text: ... Arguments passed ggplot2::scale_x_date().

title: academiadates scales for ggplot2 — academiadates-scales
text: ggproto object inheriting Scale

title: Internal vctrs methods — academiadates-vctrs
text: methods extensions allow tsibble objects work vctrs.

title: Internal vctrs methods — academiadates-vctrs
code: # S3 method for class 'yeartrimester' vec_arith(op, x, y, ...)  # S3 method for class 'yeartrimester' obj_print_data(x, ...)

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. generics intersect, setdiff, union

what: Get the academic trimester of a date-time — trimester
title: Get the academic trimester of a date-time — trimester
text: Trimesters divide year thirds. largely based lubridate::quarter.

title: Get the academic trimester of a date-time — trimester
Get the academic trimester of a date-time — trimester
text: x date-time object. type format returned trimester. Can "trimester", "ay_year trimester" (default, e.g. '2025 T1'), "ay_year.trimester" (academic year trimester numeric form), "year_start/end"., "date_last", "date_first". similar options lubridate::quarter. academic_start integer 1 12 indicating month start academic year.

title: Get the academic trimester of a date-time — trimester
text: numeric character depnding type.

title: Get the academic trimester of a date-time — trimester
code: trimester(lubridate::as_date("2024-08-24"), academic_start = 5) #> [1] "2025 T1"  trimester(lubridate::today(), academic_start = 5) #> [1] "2026 T1"  trimester(lubridate::today(), type = "trimester", academic_start = 5) #> [1] 1

title: Represent year-trimester — yeartrimester
text: Create coerce using yeartrimester().

title: Represent year-trimester — yeartrimester
code: yeartrimester(x, academic_start = 1)  make_yeartrimester(year = 1970L, trimester = 1L, academic_start = 1)  is_yeartrimester(x)  academic_year(x)

title: Represent year-trimester — yeartrimester
text: x date. academic_start numeric indicating starting month academic year. year, trimester vector numerics give year trimester values.

title: Represent year-trimester — yeartrimester
text: year-trimester (yeartrimester) object.

title: Represent year-trimester — yeartrimester
text: Use format() display yeartrimester objects desired format.

title: Represent year-trimester — yeartrimester
code: # `academic_year()` helps to extract academic year y <- yeartrimester(as.Date("2020-06-01"), academic_start = 6) academic_year(y) #> [1] 2021 lubridate::year(y) # calendar years #> [1] 2020
